content.title: Mukhya Mantri Shramyogi Prathibhavan Vidyarthi Yojana (HBOCWWB)
content.details: The scheme 'Mukhya Mantri Shramyogi Prathibhavan Vidyarthi Yojana' is implemented by the Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB). The main objective of the scheme is to provide financial assistance for full tuition fees, hostel fees, books, stationery and laptop/computer for higher education to meritorious children of registered construction workers who have secured 85% marks in senior secondary (10+2) board examination or 75% or more in Bachelor's degree course and admitted as regular students in the first year of undergraduate, postgraduate/professional courses.
benefits: ₹5,000 per year per student for purchasing books and stationery
₹49,000 per student for purchasing a laptop/computer (one-time assistance)
Up to ₹72,000 per student for hostel fees
eligibility: The applicant should be engaged in building or construction work
The applicants should be registered with the Haryana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board
The registered worker must have a minimum of one year’s regular membership
The worker must have an active membership with the Board

The worker's child must have scored 85% in the senior secondary (10+2) board examination or 75% or more in the bachelor's degree course and is continuing studies as a regular student in the next class or course

For students pursuing commercial pilot training courses and type renting courses, all institutions approved by the Director General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) are also eligible for reimbursement under the scheme

Applicants under this Scheme will not be eligible for benefits under already approved financial assistance, higher education, technical and professional courses, or any other similar scheme of the Board
This financial assistance will be payable up to the first three children of the worker

The worker has neither applied again for the same class of his/her son/daughter nor received similar benefits/financial assistance from any other government department/board/corporation, nor have they made any application for the same
exclusions: In case of failure of the student, financial assistance will not be given again for the same class
Students who are self-employed or employed will not be eligible for benefits under this scheme
documents_required: Identity proof i.e. Aadhaar Card, Voter Card

faqs.question: What are the main objectives of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The primary objective is to provide financial assistance for tuition fees, hostel fees, books, stationery, and laptops/computers for higher education.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for benefits under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Children of registered construction workers who have secured 85% marks in senior secondary (10+2) or 75% or more in Bachelor's degree course and are admitted as regular students in the first year of undergraduate, postgraduate/professional courses.

faqs.question: What are the benefits provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Financial assistance for purchasing books and stationery, laptops/computers, hostel fees, and reimbursement of tuition fees.

faqs.question: How much financial assistance is provided for books and stationery?
faqs.answer: An amount of ₹5,000 per year per student is payable for purchasing books and stationery.

faqs.question: Is there any one-time financial assistance for purchasing laptops/computers?
faqs.answer: Yes, ₹49,000 per student will be payable once during the course for purchasing a laptop/computer.

faqs.question: How much assistance is provided for hostel fees?
faqs.answer: Up to ₹72,000 per student will be payable for hostel fees.

faqs.question: Is tuition fee reimbursed under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, reimbursement of tuition fees is also provided.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for applicants?
faqs.answer: Applicants must be engaged in building or construction work, registered with the Haryana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, and have at least one year's regular membership.

faqs.question: What academic criteria must the worker's child meet?
faqs.answer: The child must have scored 85% in senior secondary (10+2) or 75% or more in Bachelor's degree course and must be continuing studies as a regular student in the next class or course.

faqs.question: Are there any exclusions under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, students who fail and those who are self-employed or employed are not eligible for benefits.

faqs.question: Can students pursuing commercial pilot training courses benefit from this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, they are eligible for reimbursement under the scheme if the institution is approved by the DGCA.

faqs.question: How many children of the worker can benefit from this scheme?
faqs.answer: Financial assistance will be payable up to the first three children of the worker.

faqs.question: Can applicants receive benefits from other government schemes simultaneously?
faqs.answer: No, applicants under this scheme will not be eligible for benefits under any other similar scheme of the Board.

faqs.question: Are all institutions eligible to participate in this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only institutions established within India and approved by statutory bodies are eligible.

faqs.question: Can applicants reapply for financial assistance if their child fails?
faqs.answer: No, financial assistance will not be given again for the same class if the student fails.

faqs.question: How can one apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants can visit the Official Website of the Labour Department Haryana to apply.

faqs.question: Are there any specific institutions mentioned under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, all IIMs/IITs/IIITs/AIIMS/NITs/NIFT/NID/Indian Institute of Hotel Management, National Law University, and other institutions approved by statutory bodies are eligible.
